page.title: 09Walmore Common
page.content: The primary school and houses on Walmore Hill have views to East and West from their ridge:across to the West we see a line of hills at the edge of the Forest of Dean and,in between lies the large, saucer-shaped low-lying area called Walmore Common which gets flooded frequently in the winter and spring months.Cattle and some horses graze it during the summer and autumn and it supports a variety of wild plants,birds and insects.Herons fish for eels in its ditches.The commonest trees in its surrounding hedges are Willow and Hawthorn.Damselflies frequent the reeds in the minor dyke but the major dyke is kept fairly clear.Part of this flat land within its encircling hills has been drained and is farmed,for hay mostly;the rest is rough pasture.
